wikipedia_page.main: General William Nelson Hutchinson (1803–1895) was a British Army officer who became General Officer Commanding Western District.

response: By his wife, Mary Augusta Lloyd, a cousin of Charles Lloyd, Russell had four sons (John (died 1836), Francis, William, and Arthur (died 1828)), and two daughters: Augusta, wife of the Rev. G. Bridges More; and Mary, wife of General William Nelson Hutchinson.

Hutchinson, born 16 May 1859 in London, England, was the third son of General William Nelson Hutchinson (1803–1895) and Mary Hutchinson (née Russell). He began his golfing career at an early age playing at the Royal North Devon Golf Club—also known as Westward Ho!—a course founded in 1864 and designed by Old Tom Morris.Old Tom Morris Golf Course Architecture, 1 July 2006, accessed 30 January 2012. By the age of 16, he won the club medal championship. He attended the University of Oxford's Corpus Christi College from 1878-81, where he was a cricket player, and where he made an immediate impression by playing number one on the Oxford University golf team, and led them to victory over arch-rival Cambridge in the University Golf Match.
